Topic.Title: A couple of examples of how the president has been good for business

Message.Msg: Well I guess you must have been tired when you responded, so I will give your response a C grade. In your response you faithfully followed the rules, but you were not very creative in your implementation. My critique follows: Opening statement: Classic rule 5 tactic, but again not a very creative implementation Second paragraph: A rather sad rule 4 attempt, but I must admit had I not read the article where you lifted your information, I would have probably been inclined to grade it higher Last statement: A rather nice rule 12 attempt, that verges on a C+ As I have told many of my students in the past; good rules are guidelines and should be learned and practiced, but eventually you will need to go beyond the rules and use your own intellect and imagination to reinvent the rules and/or make them better. I must admit that is what I am attempting to do for my cause. I know I am not there yet, because I am still learning how conservatives can make use of these well thought out rules that have proven their worth over the years. Again nice attempt, but a little lacking in imagination and creativity. "In your heart you know he is right" Your friend The Frogg
I'm sure there's more to this story that better explains what's going on with both imported and exported oil between the U.S. and Canada.

"You want some Obamanomics? Try this: "The December jobs figures out today indicate that there were 725,000 more jobs in the private sector than at the end of 2008 — and 697,000 fewer government jobs. That works into a private-sector gain of 0.6 percent, and a government sector decline of 3.1 percent." Bingo! THANKS! "Stop blocking cuts to unproductive old age benefits" By the way, have I mentioned lately how tired I am of paying for other people stuff. I'm wondering if you have given your "pay for your stuff" speech to Obama and Harry? How about Nancy? She is adamant that we aren't going to discuss social security, medicare or medicaid. If so, what then is there to negotiate in terms of meaningful government expense reduction?

"Obama had nothing to do with them reopening and has nothing to do with them closing." Actually, I agree. However, I couldn't resist taking a shot at him because it is he who initially seemed to suggest otherwise.

Topic.Title: A couple of examples of how the president has been good for business

Message.Msg: Why finance foreign oil production? Jimmy "Peanut" Carter shut down the pilot plant that had developed a process to take oil from the Rockies oil shale deposits at competitive prices to mid-East oil. There are also huge deposits of a methane gel in the off shore trenches. Bet you've not heard of that. The Japanese are studying ways of getting that with no ecological damage. According to our rulers in the CFR through their publication "Foreign Affairs" (very foreign) "The world is awash in oil."

Topic.Title: A couple of examples of how the president has been good for business

Message.Msg: I have no idea what you are talking about but I hope you don't actually have any students.

Topic.Title: A couple of examples of how the president has been good for business

Message.Msg: Runner, we did not finance foreign oil production. For a fee and a share of the interest the Import-Export bank provides loan guarantees to facilitate the export and import of goods. That's it. In this case the export of goods was to a foreign oil company doing some offshore drilling. Just about every country on earth has access to either it's own export credit agency or a multi-national development bank that provides these guarantees. They are a normal part of international trade. The US Export Import Banks has been quietly facilitating trade since 1934. The only reason you've ever heard of it is because some cheap conservative hack thought he could score some cheap points. He was right. You Tea Brains know nothing about business or economics. You make this strikingly obvious.

"She is adamant that we aren't going to discuss social security, medicare or medicaid. If so, what then is there to negotiate in terms of meaningful government expense reduction?" Yet they have been a part of every grand bargain negotiation and Pelosi does not have the power to stop a grand bargain passed by the Senate. Obama and Reid both support these reductions--Obama more than Reid. From what I can gather, you want high spending on your old age checks but have no interest in paying for it with taxes that may affect you. You'd rather see the safety net and infrastructure gutted. I bet you also support the payroll tax hike. Am I wrong?

I'm not entirely sure why this is confusing to you. The oil market is a global market. This is why the Keystone Pipeline wasn't expected to lower gas or oil prices in the US--because it makes it easier to export the oil. As it is now the oil has to be shipped by rail which is slower and more expensive to export compared to pipeline oil. The only question with the pipeline is whether the oil goes through the US for routing through Gulf terminals or through a Canadian pipeline to a new pacific coast terminal. But the oil is going to enter the global market--it will go wherever it fetches the highest price. This is what capitalism is all about. If you want to live in a place where government controls resources to keep prices low for the people, you're barking up the wrong economic system.

I see where our local hot dog vendor is closing up and selling his push cart. I hope Obama is satisfied now. His policies have ruined this guy. I am writing to Obama and complaining. But wait, a local guy who worked as a plumber's assistant is going out on his own and opening his own business. I guess I will write to thank Obama. His policies made all of that possible. t.bfine: How can you keep up with all of this? This is way too complicated for ole ellerbebil. I'm glad we have you to keep count of the Obama effect.

Message.Title: Ricky Response
Message.Msg: I sure do hate to start a new thread Ricky but for some reason Yahoo wouldn't provide the response option to your latest missile. You asked: "I bet you also support the payroll tax hike. Am I wrong?" While I didn't support that step as one of the best of many fix options available to law makers, it is a step in the direction to improving social security financial performance. The hike probably won't help the economy, but it's done. In my view, extending the benefit ages would have been more economy neutral. By the way, Ricky, I never enjoyed, as you have, the benefit of the lower tax rate since I retired some 6 yrs. ago. And, also by the way Ricky, I paid in at the newly restored higher rate for a great many years. So, as you are so fond of saying Ricky, pay for your stuff.
you don't have to buy it.
I can afford a gallon a week. I just don't want to buy it for the WIC, Food Stamp, and other poor people.

Topic.Title: A couple of examples of how the president has been good for business

Message.Msg: Sorry ricky, I guess I gave you more credit than you deserved. From the way you formulate your replies I assumed that you were following the rules that have been used by folks on your side for so many years. I guess you aren't as well read as I had assumed. Sorry my mistake. And to put your mind at ease, my days of teaching engineering at Southwestern Bell and other companies are over, but they were some of the best of my life. Your friend the "cheap hack" (sometimes you do make me laugh) "In your heart you know he is right" By the way I used rules 3, 4, 5, 6, 8, and of course rule 12 to formulate this response. As they say practice does make perfect.(lol) The Frogg

Message.Title: Clinton
Message.Msg: A reporter asks Bill Clinton, "How's Hillary's head?" "Well, she's no Monica."

Message.Title: A Georgia mom hides her kids and shoots an intruder 5 times
Message.Msg: Shame she didn't have one of those 10 bullet clips. She could have probably done a better job. Of course if she lived in Chicago the story would have been much different. "In your heart you know he is right" The Frogg

Topic.Title: A couple of examples of how the president has been good for business

Message.Msg: You know you live in a Country run by idiots if... You can get arrested for expired tags on your car but not for being in the country illegally. ==================================== You know you live in a Country run by idiots if... Your government believes that the best way to eradicate trillions of dollars of debt is to spend trillions more of our money. ==================================== You know you live in a Country run by idiots if... A seven year old boy can be thrown out of school for calling his teacher "cute" but hosting a sexual exploration or diversity class in grade school is perfectly acceptable. ==================================== You know you live in a Country run by idiots if... The Supreme Court of the United States can rule that lower courts cannot display the 10 Commandments in their courtroom, while sitting in front of a display of the 10 Commandments. ==================================== You know you live in a Country run by idiots if... Children are forcibly removed from parents who appropriately discipline them while children of "underprivileged" drug addicts are left to rot in filth infested cesspools of a “home”. ==================================== You know you live in a Country run by idiots if... Hard work and success are rewarded with higher taxes and government intrusion, while some slothful, lazy behavior is rewarded with EBT cards, WIC checks, Medicaid, subsidized housing, and free cell phones. ==================================== You know you live in a Country run by idiots if... The government's plan for getting people back to work is to provide 99 weeks of unemployment checks (to not work). ==================================== You know you live in a Country run by idiots if... Being self-sufficient is considered a threat to the government. ==================================== You know you live in a Country run by idiots if... Politicians think that stripping away the amendments to the constitution is really protecting the rights of the people. ==================================== You know you live in a Country run by idiots if... The rights of the Government come before the rights of the individual. ==================================== You know you live in a Country run by idiots if... You can write a post like this just by reading the news headlines. ==================================== You know you live in a Country run by idiots if... You pay your mortgage faithfully, denying yourself the newest big screen TV while your neighbor defaults on his mortgage (while buying iPhones, TV's and new cars) and the government forgives his debt and reduces his mortgage (with your tax dollars). ==================================== You know you live in a Country run by idiots if... Being stripped of the ability to defend yourself makes you "safe". ==================================== You know you live in a Country run by idiots if... You have to have your parents signature to go on a school field trip but not to get an abortion. ==================================== You know you live in a Country run by idiots if... An 80 year old woman can be stripped searched by the TSA but a Muslim woman in a burka is only subject to having her neck and head searched. ==================================== You know you live in a Country run by idiots if... Using the "N" word is considered "hate speech" but writing and singing songs about raping women and killing cops is considered "art". ====================================
